Doc: A description of how a numerical derivative is computed.

Source.Contents:
/#
   A description of how a numerical derivative is computed.
 #/
record FpML5.reporting.DerivativeCalculationProcedure {
  # The method by which a derivative is computed, e.g. analytic, numerical model, perturbation, etc.
  method : string?

  # The size and direction of the perturbation used to compute the derivative, e.g. 0.0001 = 1 bp.
  perturbationAmount : decimal?

  # The value is calculated by perturbing by the perturbationAmount and then the negative of the perturbationAmount and then averaging the two values (i.e. the value is half of the difference between perturbing up and perturbing down).
  averaged : boolean?

  # The type of perturbation, if any, used to compute the derivative (Absolute vs Relative).
  perturbationType : string?

  # The formula used to compute the derivative (perhaps could be updated to use the Formula type in EQS.).
  derivativeFormula : string?

  # A reference to the replacement version of the market input, e.g. a bumped yield curve.
  replacementMarketInput : FpML5.reporting.PricingStructureReference?

}

method.Doc: The method by which a derivative is computed, e.g. analytic, numerical model, perturbation, etc.
method.Name: method

perturbationAmount.Doc: The size and direction of the perturbation used to compute the derivative, e.g. 0.0001 = 1 bp.
perturbationAmount.Name: perturbationAmount

averaged.Doc: The value is calculated by perturbing by the perturbationAmount and then the negative of the perturbationAmount and then averaging the two values (i.e. the value is half of the difference between perturbing up and perturbing down).
averaged.Name: averaged

perturbationType.Doc: The type of perturbation, if any, used to compute the derivative (Absolute vs Relative).
perturbationType.Name: perturbationType

derivativeFormula.Doc: The formula used to compute the derivative (perhaps could be updated to use the Formula type in EQS.).
derivativeFormula.Name: derivativeFormula

replacementMarketInput.Doc: A reference to the replacement version of the market input, e.g. a bumped yield curve.
replacementMarketInput.Name: replacementMarketInput
